about.title: About
about.body: My photo album was so full of pictures that my friends eventually nicknamed me “the tourist.” The tourist is me: Laiquah Pandore, a student at Paris-Panthéon Sorbonne University. Ever since I was young, I’ve loved capturing moments to turn them into memories, creating photo albums. I enjoy photographing people as well as nature, landscapes, my home island of La Réunion, and the city where I currently live: Paris. This passion also developed during my university studies. Over three years at journalism school, I learned how to shoot videos, produce reports, edit footage, and tell stories. Then, as I continued my studies in a Master’s program, I took a photography course. That was when I fell in love with this art form—seeing what others don’t see. Capturing my reality is what drives me. I wanted to fully commit to this passion, to acquire solid technical foundations and develop my photographer’s eye. That’s why I share some of my creations and my work on this site. Feel free to contact me if you would like more information.
